hugo.footer-about-us: We are Datenanfragen.de e. V., a registered non-profit from Germany. We have made it our mission to help you exercise your right to privacy.
hugo.home-hero-desc:
Companies have to give you access to your data and correct or even delete them if necessary.
As a non-profit association, we help you use those rights – free of charge and registration, of course.
hugo.home-claim-title: This is how data requests work:
hugo.home-claim-choose-company: Choose companies from our database, or add your own. You don’t know who to request? In that case, we have some suggestions.
hugo.home-claim-send: From your details we generate a request, which you then send yourself, usually via email. We never get to see your data.
hugo.home-claim-react: Within one month, you should get what you requested. Check in regularly and we will remind you if you need to follow up with the company. We also help you assess the answer and complain if needed.
hugo.home-blog-section-desc: We report on our experiences and publish tips or research about data requests and other privacy-related topics. We also regularly post updates from our association or our website.
hugo.adb-title: List of supervisory data protection authorities
hugo.adb-explanation:
Our supervisory authority database holds the contact details for the supervisory data protection authorities in the EU.

The supervisory authorities are independent entities whose purpose it is to make sure data protection laws are followed. If you think that a company hasn’t correctly responded to your requests or is processing your data illegally, you can always submit a complaint with them at no cost. To learn more, have a look at our post on the data protection authorities.
hugo.cdb-company-heading: Contact information for privacy-related requests to “{{ .Params.name }}”
hugo.cdb-runs-extended: “{{ .Params.name }}” is also responsible for the following entities and services:
hugo.cdb-intro: We have the following contact information on “{{ .Params.name }}” for you to use for privacy-related requests:
hugo.adb-intro: We have the following contact information on “{{ .Params.name }}” for you to use to lodge complaints:
hugo.cdb-tested: At least one of our contributors has successfully sent a request using the contact details in this record.
hugo.cdb-help-needed: Is this data inaccurate or the company you were looking for not in our database? Suggest an edit to this company or a new one. Thanks for your help!
hugo.cdb-warning-unverified: Warning: We have not verified the details in this record, they have been imported automatically. Something wrong? We would greatly appreciate if you submitted a correction. Thanks for your help!
hugo.cdb-cc0-explanation: This database is licensed under a CC0 1.0 Universal license.
hugo.cdb-meta-ai-objection: Meta has announced its intent to use any public posts that users have shared on its services for training so-called “Artificial Intelligence (AI)” systems starting on May 27, 2025 unless they object. While we and other data protection organisations across Europe believe that this is in violation of applicable law, we do recommend that you submit an objection to Meta as soon as possible if you don’t want your data to be used for this purpose. The only reliable way to do this is by using the web form for the respective service:
hugo.cdb-meta-ai-objection-facebook: Object to your information being used for “AI” at Facebook
hugo.cdb-meta-ai-objection-instagram: Object to your information being used for “AI” at Instagram
hugo.cdb-meta-ai-objection-whatsapp: As far as we are aware, there is currently no form for objection to your information being used for “AI” at WhatsApp. We believe that Meta’s policy does not apply to your private WhatsApp messages since those cannot be classified as public posts.
hugo.cdb-obsolete-record-heading: “{{ .Params.name }}” has been removed from our database
hugo.cdb-obsolete-record: “{{ .Params.name }}” has been removed from our company database.
hugo.cdb-obsolete-reason-company-merged: It has been merged with another company/service.
hugo.cdb-obsolete-reason-gdpr-not-applicable: The GDPR is not applicable to this company/service.
hugo.cdb-obsolete-reason-out-of-scope: It is out of scope for our database.
hugo.noscript-generator: The generator runs only on your computer and is therefore completely written in JavaScript. The code won't send any data to any servers if you do not consent. If you want to use the generator, please activate JavaScript in your browser or add an exception to your blocker. If it still doesn't work after that, send us an email at dev@datenanfragen.de.
hugo.noscript-my-requests: All requests are saved and shown on your computer using JavaScript (of course only if it is activated). The code won't send any data to any servers if you do not consent. If you want to save and see your requests on your computer, please activate JavaScript in your browser or add an exception to your blocker. If it still doesn't work after that, send us an email at dev@datenanfragen.de.
hugo.noscript-actwidget: Here would have been a tool to quickly generate a GDPR request. It only runs on your computer and is therefore completely written in JavaScript. If you want to use it, please enable JavaScript in your browser. If it still doesn't work after that, send us an email at dev@datenanfragen.de.
hugo.noscript-sva: Here would have been a tool to quickly find the supervisory authority responsible for you. It only runs on your computer and is therefore completely written in JavaScript. If you want to use it, please enable JavaScript in your browser. If it still doesn't work after that, send us an email at dev@datenanfragen.de.
hugo.press-no-releases: At this time there are no press releases in English.
hugo.404-body: The page you were looking for sadly doesn't exist on this server. Maybe you just have a typo in the URL? If the error persists, perhaps notify us via our email dev@datenanfragen.de or submit an issue in our issue tracker.
hugo.404-alt: A person sitting on the 0 of a big 404 sign. They are holding a book with a missing page.
hugo.verein-home-card-mission-content:
What are our goals, why have we started this non-profit? And how do we plan on helping you and others through it?
Here are some answers to these questions.
hugo.verein-home-card-donate-content: We want to keep our project free and open to everyone. If you want to help us do that and launch new projects, consider donating to us. We are very grateful for every donation.
hugo.verein-home-card-join-content: Our project is meant for participation. Whether you want to contribute and help with the development or you just want to be closer to the action, we will be happy to welcome you with us.
hugo.event-no-events: Currently, there are no planned events and no recordings available.
hugo.footer-social-rss-desc: Subscribe to our blog posts using your RSS feed reader.
hugo.noscript-app: The request generator runs only on your computer and is therefore completely written in JavaScript. The code sends as little data as possible to our servers if you do not consent. This might include searches you make, but it will never send the data you enter for your requests. This data will only remain locally in your browser. If you want to use the generator, please activate JavaScript in your browser or add an exception to your JavaScript blocker. If it still doesn’t work after that, send us an email at dev@datenanfragen.de.

search.search-disabled: You have disabled the search feature. If you want to enable it, have a look at the privacy controls.
search.no-results: Unfortunately, there were no results for your query.
search.no-company: Unfortunately, we don’t have the details for the company you’re searching for yet. But you can always add a custom company and enter the details yourself.
search.quality-tested: At least one of our contributors has successfully sent a request using the contact details in this record.
search.quality-unverified: The contact details in this record were imported automatically. They have not been verified by us.

cdb.title: Company database
cdb.explanation: Our company database holds the contact information of many companies (as well as other organisations) for your privacy-related requests.

my-requests.title: My requests
my-requests.explanation: Here is a list of all requests you have generated so far with this browser. This can for example be useful to check whether a company answers within the timeframe you set.
my-requests.explanation-saving: This data is saved exclusively on your own computer and will never be sent to us. It will remain saved until you use your browser’s Clear Browsing Data feature or delete all requests below. You can also export all data as a CSV file.
my-requests.no-requests: You haven't generated any requests yet. As soon as you start doing that, they will appear here.
my-requests.ics-desc:
You have sent GDPR requests to the companies listed below through 
 ${site_name}. The period for those requests has now elapsed. If you 
 have not received an answer to one more of those requests, you may 
 now send warnings: 
 ${base_url}/my-requests
my-requests.delete-proceeding-confirm: This will delete this proceeding and all messages it contains. Are you sure?
my-requests.import-message-modal-explanation: To keep track of messages you send and receive regarding your original request, you can add their metadata here.
my-requests.subject: Subject
my-requests.content-placeholder: Copy or summarize the content of the message here, so that you can remember it later.
my-requests.transport-medium-input-label: Which way was the message transmitted?
my-requests.radio-sent-by-someone-else: It was sent by someone else.
my-requests.delete-message-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete the message?
my-requests.confirm-cancel-add-message: This deletes what you just entered. Do you still want to cancel?

reminder-widget-summary.one: You have one overdue request. React now or mark it as satisfactory.
reminder-widget-summary.other: You have {{proceedings}} overdue requests. React now or mark them as satisfactory.

my-requests.invalid-date-entered: The date you entered was invalid.

generator.request-type: What kind of request do you want to generate?
generator.id-data-explanation:
The data you specify here will help the company identify you. Feel free to err on the side of entering less—the company will contact you if they need more details.
Those fields, we know from experience definitely have to be filled in, are marked with an *.
generator.id-data-tracking-explanation:
We cannot tell you which data the company you selected needs to identify you. After your request, the company will respond with an explanation on how you can collect this data.
Please specify how you want the company to contact you here. We recommend giving them your email address.
generator.add-dynamic-input-explanation: Want to add more data? No problem: Just select the type of input you want to add. You can also add your saved inputs.
generator.name: Name
generator.tagxplanation: You can use the tags <italic></italic> and <bold></bold> in your text. Nested tags are not supported.
generator.subject: Subject
generator.data-portability: Get data in a machine-readable format
generator.include-objection: Additionally include an objection based on your particular situation
generator.objection-reason-explanation: An objection has to be justified based on your particular situation. Explain why you specifically object to the company processing your data.
generator.rectification-data-explanation: Enter the data you want to be corrected. You can enter data that is not needed for the identification.
generator.modal-autocomplete-new-request: A new company has been selected. Do you want to start a new request?
generator.modal-new-request: You have not yet used your generated request. Do you still want to reset all fields and start new request or rather load the request first?
generator.request-transport-medium: How do you want to send your request?
generator.error-template-not-found: The request template could not be found.
generator.error-template-fetch-failed: Fetching the request template failed with an unknown error.
generator.mailto-dropdown-explanation: How do you want to send the email?
generator.mailto-dropdown-warning: *This will transmit your request and the included data to the respective service.
generator.copymanually-explanation: Here you can copy the subject, recipient and text of your generated email manually.
generator.webform-modal-explanation: Here you can copy the subject and text of your generated request to paste them into the web form.
generator.request-type-info-access: Through an access request, you can find out whether a company has data on you and, if so, receive a copy of said data. In addition, the company will inform you about what they use your data for, to whom they disclose it, where it came from, and for how long they keep it.
generator.request-type-info-erasure: Through an erasure request, you can get a company to delete some or all of the data they have on you. This is possible if the data is no longer necessary for the purpose it was collected for, if the company relies on your consent for processing the data, or if it is being processing illegally.
generator.request-type-info-rectification: Through a rectification request, you can get a company to correct any wrong data they may have on you.
generator.request-type-info-objection: Through a direct marketing objection, you can forbid a company from using your data to send you advertisements.
generator.request-type-info-learn-more: Learn more about the request types
generator.confirm-cancel-add-custom-company: Are you sure you want to cancel? The data you entered will be lost.
generator.add-custom-company-explanation: Fill in the company’s details here. You only need to fill in the name, all other fields are optional. Many companies have privacy-specific contact details that you should use instead of the general support ones. You can typically find those in the company’s privacy policy.
generator.want-to-suggest-checkbox: Suggest the company for our database?
generator.want-to-suggest-provide-sources: Please provide sources so we can verify your suggestion.
generator.want-to-suggest-disclaimer:
After you submit the form, the data you entered below will be publicly visible in our GitHub repository. So, please do not enter any personal data here. For more information, please refer to our privacy policy.

You agree for your suggestion to be published in our company database under a CC0 license, which allows anyone to use it without restrictions.
generator.request-type-chooser-page-title: What do you want to do?
generator.company-chooser-page-title: Who do you want to address your request to?
generator.empty-query-suggested-companies: No idea who to request? We have some suggestions for you:
generator.needs-id-document: An ID document is required to request this entity.
generator.only-snail-mail: You might need to send your request via physical mail.
generator.only-fax: You might need to send your request by fax.
generator.only-webform: You might need to send your request via a web form.
generator.choose-runs: Show and select other entities run by this company.
generator.also-runs-choose: This company is also responsible for these other entities or services (deselect the ones you do not want to request):
generator.consider-as-tracking-company: My request to this company concerns tracking data and I don’t know how the company can identify me for this purpose.
generator.review-selection-explanation: These are the companies you have selected. For companies that are responsible for other entities or services, you can select which ones you want to include in your request. Once you’re happy with your selection, you can start generating the requests.
generator.send-request-pdf-explanation: Here’s your generated request. Download the PDF and send it to the company via letter or fax.
generator.send-request-email-explanation: Here’s your generated request. You’ll need to send it to the company by email yourself.
generator.send-request-webform-explanation: Here’s your generated request. You’ll need to send it to the company yourself using the web form.
generator.whats-next-deadline: The companies now have one month to reply to your requests. They can extend this deadline to a total of three months when necessary but need to inform you of that within the first month.
generator.whats-next-my-requests: You can view your sent requests on the “My requests” page. There, you can follow up on them, including sending warnings or even complain to the data protection authorities if a company doesn’t respond correctly. You can also save a reminder for the request deadlines to your calendar.
generator.app-introduction: We’ll guide you through sending your request(s). Start by choosing what kind of request you want to send.
generator.objection-request-explanation-button: What is a direct marketing objection?

requests.letter-subject-erasure: Request for erasure of personal data according to Art. 17 GDPR
requests.letter-subject-access: Request to access to personal data according to Art. 15 GDPR
requests.letter-subject-rectification: Request for rectification of personal data according to Art. 16 GDPR
requests.letter-subject-objection: Objection against direct marketing according to Art. 21(2) GDPR
requests.letter-subject-complaint: Complaint according to Art. 77 GDPR against {{request_recipient}}
requests.letter-subject-admonition: Admonition: Request according to Art. {{request_article}} GDPR
requests.name: Name
requests.recommend-language: This site is also available in your language!
requests.language-change-modal:
Changing the language will redirect you to another domain. Your settings and saved data from this domain will not carry over.
In particular, this means that things like your privacy settings and saved requests will not be available in the new language. You can still always go back to this language and view them here but you cannot share settings and saved data between different languages.

privacy-controls.title: Privacy controls
privacy-controls.explanation:
We deeply value your right to privacy and try to limit data collection and processing as much as possible. Most of the features on ${site_name} will be run directly on your computer and the data you enter will never even reach our servers. There are however some features we cannot offer without collecting some data (most settings even on this page do not require that, though).
Here, you have the option to decide yourself which features you want to enable.

When you set any of the options below, your choice will be saved in a cookie. If we don’t find a cookie for an option, we use a default value which we have decided on.
privacy-controls.confirm-delete-my-requests: You have disabled the “my requests” feature. Do you also want to delete all saved requests?
privacy-controls.search-description:
Our company database holds privacy-related contact data for many companies which makes sending requests to them a lot simpler. To find the companies you are looking for, you can use our search engine.
In order for that to work, we need to send the search terms you enter to one of our servers. We do not keep any logs of such requests, though.
privacy-controls.save_my_requests-description: To make managing your previous requests easier, we offer the “My requests” feature. If you enable it, all requests you generate will be saved on your own computer (using the local storage feature of your browser) and you can later browse through them here. There, you can also delete all saved request data at any time or export it as a CSV file.
privacy-controls.save_id_data-description: To make sending new requests easier, we can save your identification data for you. The data will only be saved on your computer (using the local storage feature of your browser) and never be send to any servers, including ours. You can easily control the data that is saved about you via the “My saved data” feature. You can always delete all of your data here or in your browser.
privacy-controls.confirm-delete-id_data: You deactivated the saving of identification data. Do you also want to delete the currently saved data?
privacy-controls.modal-clear-requests: This will delete all saved requests and cannot be undone. Are you sure?
privacy-controls.modal-clear-id_data: This will delete your saved identification data. Are you sure?
privacy-controls.modal-delete-single-request: Are you sure you want to delete this request? This cannot be undone.
privacy-controls.feature-disabled: You have disabled this feature. If you want to enable it, have a look at the privacy controls.
privacy-controls.feature-disabled-alt: Feature disabled through the privacy controls

error-handler.explanation: Unfortunately, an unexpected error just occurred. We would really appreciate if you took the time to send us an error report via GitHub or email, so we can diagnose the problem. Huge thanks in advance!
error-handler.privacy: For details on how what data error reports contain and how we process said data, please refer to our privacy policy.
error-handler.explain-context: If applicable, please provide some context for the error, i.e. describe what you did before the error occurred. Please also remove any sensitive information from the debug information below.
error-handler.no-internet: Seems like you don't have a working internet connection.
error-handler.browser-too-old: An error occured, but you are running an unsupported browser. Please update your browser or switch to a modern one.

error-msg.company-not-found: The company you were looking for could not be found.
error-msg.sva-not-found: Loading the data on the supervisory authority failed.
error-msg.indexeddb-error: An unexpected error occured while trying to access the database in your browser.

suggest.success: Your contribution has been sent successfully. Thank you! We will now review it as soon as possible.
suggest.error: Unfortunately, sending your contribution has failed. Please make sure that you are connected to the internet and not blocking requests to backend.datenanfragen.de through an add-on like uMatrix or NoScript.
suggest.no-input: You need to enter something to submit a suggestion.
suggest.name-or-web-missing: Please enter at least a name or website.
suggest.similarly-named-companies: We already have these similarly named companies:
suggest.invalid-request: Some of your entries are not in the right format or incomplete. Correct them and send your suggestion again.
suggest.github-error: There was a problem with GitHub while sending your suggestion, it was not registered. Please try again.
suggest.view-on-github: You can follow the progress on GitHub

schema.name: Name
schema.required-id-document-elements: Required elements on the ID document

id-data-controls.id-data-deactivated: Saving of identification data is deactivated. If you want to speed up the generation process and save identification data, please activate ID data saving in the privacy controls.
id-data-controls.always-fill-in-explain: The saved data can be filled automatically in the fields of new requests.
id-data-controls.add-dynamic-input-explanation: The data above is usually used to identify you. But if you want, you can always add more data here that you also need regularly. You can then add it manually in the generator. Add data by selecting the field type.
id-data-controls.saved-data-explanation: This data is the information you entered in the generator in your requests to identify yourself to a company. You can fill it into new requests now, which comes in handy especially when you want to generate many requests at once. We saved this data for you on your computer, it was never and will never be sent to us. You can choose to fill all requests automatically so that generating a request is merely a click on the download button. Just check the checkbox below. For more information on your data, take a look at the privacy controls.

signature.signature-explanation: If you want, you can sign your request. Just keep your mouse pressed and draw into the canvas.
signature.signature-explanation-id-data: If you want, you can save your signature here. If you activated the automatic fill in, we will always add it to your request or you can simply add it manually. Just keep your mouse pressed and draw into the canvas.
signature.overlay-text: You have enabled your browser’s fingerprinting protection. For us to be able to access your signature, you need to allow that first.

i18n-widget.not-supported-prompt: Your language or country is not supported yet?

comments.author: Author
comments.send-success: Comment sent successfully. It will have to be accepted by an administrator first before it is shown here.
comments.send-error: An error occurred while sending your comment. Please try again later.
comments.send-too-long: An error occurred while sending your comment. Your comment is too long.
comments.error-no-message: Please enter a comment to send.
comments.warning-loading-failed: Loading the comments for this page failed. Please make sure that you are connected to the internet and not blocking requests to backend.datenanfragen.de through an add-on like uMatrix or NoScript.
comments.no-comments: No comments here yet. Why don’t you leave one?
comments.rss-link: Subscribe to the comments on this post using your RSS/Atom feed reader.
comments.warning:
Please note that we are an independent non-profit and not affiliated with the company listed here.
If you need support or want to send a request, please contact the company directly. We cannot help you in such cases. Thanks for your understanding.
comments.confirm-private-data: Whoops, looks like your comment might contain private data or refer to an order. Do you really want to post this as a PUBLIC comment? Comments will NOT be sent to the company.
comments.regex-sus-words: order number|confirmation number|tracking number|transfer number|customer number|IBAN|bank account|payment reference|bank transfer|withdrawal|deposit|subscription fee|return address|refund|transaction|booking|reserveration|package|parcel|bitcoin|scam|invoice|order
comments.no-email-in-name: Please don’t provide an email address in the name field. Comments are posted publicly and will not be sent to the company.

company-packs.add-all-star: All companies in this pack are relevant to most people in your country.
company-packs.choose-companies-button: Choose companies to add to your requests
company-packs.address-brokers-description: These companies collect the postal and/or email addresses of individuals and sell services based on them to other businesses. Some sell or rent their address data to advertisers (often in combination with additional attributes such as interests), others offer companies to check their already stored addresses and correct them if necessary.
company-packs.credit-agencies-description: These companies collect data on your payment history, your banking transactions, mobile phone contracts, and much more in order to calculate a score for your creditworthiness, which can supposedly estimate how likely it is that you will meet a payment obligation, for example.
company-packs.public-authorities-description: Given the large number of public bodies that potentially collect your data, we can only suggest a small selection here. However, you should also think about authorities at the state and local level, such as registration offices.

reactor.error-invalid-reference: The proceeding you specified in the URL doesn’t exist.
reactor.ianal-warning: While our wizard can cover a lot of the common problems that occur during requests, it is of course not legal advice. If you are unsure about anything, please always consult a lawyer. We can unfortunately not help with any legal questions relating to particular cases.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_additional-id: Company requires additional data for identification.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_custom-text: I want to write my own message.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_other-language: Company answered in a different language.
reactor.base_response-or-complaint_body_has-comp: You have already sent an admonition to the company and lodged a complaint with the supervisory authorities. Do you want to send a free text response to the company now?
reactor.base_response-or-complaint_body_has-admo: You have already sent an admonition to the company. Do you want to send a free text response or lodge a complaint with the supervisory authorities now?
reactor.base_response-or-complaint_option_free: Write a free text response to the company.
reactor.base_response-or-complaint_option_neverm: Nevermind, mark the request as completed.
reactor.base_select-issue_body_problem: Has there been a problem with your request?
reactor.base_select-issue_body_additional-issues: Do you want to mention any additional issues in your complaint?
reactor.base_select-issue_option_generate-compla: Generate complaint based on your answers.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_generate-respon: Generate response based on your answers.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_generate-admoni: Generate admonition based on your answers.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_completed: No. Quit wizard and mark request as completed.
reactor.base_complaint-less-than-two-weeks_body: In your admonition, you gave the company a deadline of two weeks. Those have not passed yet. If the company has since denied to comply with your request, it is of course fine to lodge a complaint now. Otherwise, you should wait until the deadline has passed. What do you want to do?
reactor.base_complaint-less-than-two-weeks_optio: Write a free text response to the company instead.
reactor.base_complaint-intro_body: We’ll go through each of the issues you raised in your previous response to the controller.
reactor.base_complaint-issue-resolved_body:
In your admonition, you said that {{youSaidThat}}

Has that issue been resolved? And do you want to include it in your complaint?
reactor.base_complaint-issue-changed_body:
{{youSaidThat}}

If the situation regarding this issue changed since your admonition to the controller, you need to answer the questions again. Otherwise, we can just use your previous answers.
reactor.base_complaint-choose-sva_body: Now, we need to find the supervisory authority that is responsible for your complaint. We’ll guide you through the process, just answer the questions.
reactor.base_complaint-id-data_body: How do you want the supervisory authority to contact you?
reactor.base_complaint-share-data_body: Can the supervisory authority share your details with the company? Note that most authorities say that they usually cannot process your individual complaint unless you allow this. They will however still view it as a suggestion to look into the company.
reactor.base_nevermind_body: You’ve marked this request as completed.
reactor.base_dead-end_body: In this case, we cannot proceed with the problem you selected. This could mean that the company acted correctly. But it could also just be that this tool doesn’t support your particular case (yet). You can continue with another reason, if applicable.
reactor.base_dead-end_option_next: Check if there is another problem with the company’s response.
reactor.base_generate-letter_body_response: Here’s your generated response. Please check the text and edit it if necessary. Afterwards, you’ll need to send it to the company.
reactor.base_generate-letter_body_complaint: Here’s your generated complaint. Please check the text and edit it if necessary. Afterwards, you’ll need to send it to the supervisory authority. Remember to attach your correspondence with the company to the message.
reactor.base_generate-letter_body_admonition: Here’s your generated admonition. Please check the text and edit it if necessary. Afterwards, you’ll need to send it to the company.
reactor.additional-id_start_body: Has the company set forth any reasonable doubts concerning your identity that could be remedied using additional identification data? Or are they apparent?
reactor.additional-id_reasonable-doubts_body: Do you have any objections to these doubts? Do you think the company can sufficiently identify you without this data?
reactor.additional-id_user-no-objections_body: Can you/do you want to provide the identification data requested by the company?
reactor.additional-id_provide-data_body: Please enter the additional identification data requested by the company.
reactor.additional-id_no-reasonable-doubts_body: Why do you think that you’ve sufficiently identified yourself in your request?
reactor.additional-id_no-reasonable-doubts_optio: The request concerns an online account but the company wants “real-world” identification data.
The company wants more data than is necessary to identify me for the request.
reactor.additional-id_explain-reasoning_body: Please explain why the identification data requested by the company is not necessary for the request.
reactor.custom-text_start_body: Please enter the message you want to send to the company.
reactor.other-language_start_body:
Companies have to communicate with you in easily accessible form, using clear and plain language. A company that offers a service in a country should also offer answers in the language that is understood by the people in that country.

What language was your request in?
reactor.other-language_response-language_body: What language was the company’s response in?
reactor.other-language_does-user-understand-resp: Do you understand the company’s response?
reactor.excessive_start_body:
Companies can only [controller_wants_to_charge>charge for requests][controller_refuses>refuse to act on requests] if they are manifestly unfounded or excessive[controller_wants_to_charge> or if you are asking for additional copies of your data].

Has the company specified why they [controller_wants_to_charge>want to charge you for your request][controller_refuses>refuse to act on your request]?
reactor.excessive_start_option_too-many: They claim that I sent them too many requests or sent requests too often.
reactor.excessive_start_option_additional-copy: They say that I have requested an additional copy of my data.
reactor.excessive_start_option_no-reason: They have not given a reason.
reactor.excessive_too-many_body: How many requests have you sent to the company in total (including this one)?
reactor.excessive_too-many-more-than-one_body:
You are allowed to send multiple requests to the same company at reasonable intervals at no cost. What is considered a reasonable interval depends on the particular situation. For example, social media platforms tend to continuously collect a lot of data about you. As such, a shorter interval between requests like three months is appropriate. Conversely, if you only ever ordered once from an online shop and they already provided you all data regarding this transaction, it is unlikely that the data they have on you changes frequently. Either way, the supervisory authorities say that a one-year interval is reasonable in all cases.

Given the vast amount of possible cases, we can unfortunately not automatically generate a reasoning on whether and why the amount of requests you have sent is reasonable. Please write that yourself.
reactor.excessive_additional-copy_body: Have you ever sent a previous request to the company?
reactor.excessive_additional-copy-prior-request_:
Companies can in fact charge you if you ask for additional copies of your data. But this only applies if your request concerns the same data as a previous. If, however, you reasonably believe that your new request concerns different data (e.g. different data types or a different time frame), the right to a free copy applies again.

Do you believe your new request concerns different data than the one the company has mentioned?
reactor.excessive_other-reason_body: In this case, we can unfortunately not provide a pre-written response. Please explain yourself why you believe your request is neither unfounded nor excessive.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_not-free: Company wants to charge for request.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_action-refusal: Company refuses to act on request.
reactor.id-copy_start_body_admonition: Requiring a copy of an identity document is an invasive measure that poses a risk for the security of your personal data. It is only appropriate if strictly necessary. Do any of the following counterarguments apply?
reactor.id-copy_start_body_other: Requiring a copy of an identity document is only appropriate if strictly necessary. Which of the following applies?
reactor.id-copy_start_option_unknown-id: The company doesn’t know me by my real-life identity.
reactor.id-copy_start_option_online-account: My request concerns an online account.
reactor.id-copy_start_option_explain-reasoning-c: I can provide my own argument for why requiring an ID copy is not appropriate
reactor.id-copy_start_option_explain-reasoning-o: I can provide my own counterargument
reactor.id-copy_start_option_unredacted-required: I am willing to provide an ID copy but the company explicitly said that it has to be unredacted.
reactor.id-copy_start_option_none: No, none of the above apply.
reactor.id-copy_explain-reasoning_body: Please explain why you think a copy of an identity document is not necessary for your request.
reactor.id-copy_no-counterargument_body: In this case, we’ll assume that the company can legitimately ask for an ID copy. Can you/do you want to provide a copy of an identity document for the request? You will be able to redact all information that is not necessary for confirming your identity.
reactor.id-copy_redaction-info_body: The company can only require you to provide the information that is necessary for confirming your identity. All other information of the ID copy can be redacted. Has the company informed you which data you can redact?
reactor.id-copy_redaction-info_option_explicit-r: The company explicitly said I cannot redact anything on the ID copy.
reactor.id-copy_attach-copy_body: Please create a copy of your identity copy with all unnecessary information redacted and attach that to the message to the company.
reactor.id-copy_attach-copy_option_another-probl: Check if there is another problem with the company’s response.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_id-document-req: Company requires a copy of an identity document.
reactor.overdue_start_body: In general, companies have one month to answer your request. That period has now been exceeded. They can extend the deadline by an additional two months only if necessary and if they inform you of the extension and its reasons. Did they do that?
reactor.overdue_controller-gave-reason_body: Do you think the reason the company gave is appropriate?
reactor.overdue_controller-gave-invalid-reason_b: Please explain why you don’t think the reasoning the company gave for extending the period is appropriate.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_not-answered: Company has not answered the request yet.
reactor.signature_start_body:
Companies are not allowed to require you to sign your request because they cannot impose their own formal requirements on requests. Besides, signatures are obviously not an appropriate way to identify you.

Does the company have your signature on file? Note that the company cannot require your signature either way, the issue would just be even more clear-cut if they don’t even have your signature on file in the first place.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_signature-requi: Company requires request to be signed.
reactor.wrong-medium_start_body:
Companies are not allowed to impose their own formal requirements on how you send requests like requiring requests to be sent via a particular medium.

Why has the company refused to answer your request?
reactor.wrong-medium_start_option_wrong-transpor: It was not sent using a particular transport medium.
reactor.wrong-medium_start_option_web-form: It was not sent through their web form/self-service tool.
reactor.wrong-medium_start_option_wrong-contact: It was sent to another contact than they want.
reactor.wrong-medium_wrong-transport-medium_body: How does the company want you to send your request?
reactor.wrong-medium_other-medium_body: Please enter the transport medium the company wants you to use.
reactor.wrong-medium_wrong-contact_body: Companies are not required to answer requests sent to random contacts not involved in the matter, but they can’t only answer requests sent to a particular point of contact, either. Where have you sent your request?
reactor.wrong-medium_wrong-contact_option_privac: privacy contact per their privacy policy
reactor.wrong-medium_wrong-contact_option_dpo: data protection officer per their privacy policy
reactor.wrong-medium_wrong-contact_option_other: another point of contact I believe is reasonable
reactor.wrong-medium_wrong-contact-reasoning_bod: Please explain why you think the point of contact you sent your request to was reasonable.
reactor.base_select-issue_option_wrong-medium: Company claims request was sent via the wrong medium or to the wrong contact.

sva-finder.loading-sva: Loading data on the selected authority…
sva-finder.result: Based on your answers, the following data protection authority is responsible for your case:
sva-finder.de-q: Which of the following areas does your request concern?
sva-finder.private: Any other public or private entity (e. g. company, non-profit, state or local authority)
sva-finder.private-q: Is the entity that your request concerns also based in Germany?
sva-finder.private-de-q: In which state is the entity your request concerns based?
sva-finder.private-other: Entity is based in other country
sva-finder.private-other-q: In which state do you live?
sva-finder.bund: Federal authority or other federal public body
sva-finder.bund-jobcenter: Job centre (except those with authorised municipal carriers)
sva-finder.bund-sueg: Private company, in cases under the Security Clearance Check Act (“Sicherheitsüberprüfungsgesetz”)
sva-finder.bund-kk: Statutory health insurance (except AOK, IKK Brandenburg and Berlin, IKK Südwest, and health insurances directly under the control of a federal state)
sva-finder.kirche-q: Which religion/denomination does your request concern?
sva-finder.bay-q: Does your request concern a public or a private entity?
sva-finder.priv: Private entity (e. g. company or non-profit)
sva-finder.ev-q: Which church or Diakonisches Werk does your request concern?
sva-finder.evdsbkd: Evangelical Lutheran Church of Saxony, Evangelical Church of Anhalt, Diakonie Saxony, Diakonie Central Germany
sva-finder.kath-q: Which diocese does your request concern?
sva-finder.kathbay: Bavarian dioceses (diocese of Augsburg, archdiocese of Bamberg, diocese of Eichstätt, archdiocese of München & Freising, diocese of Passau, diocese of Regensburg, diocese of Würzburg)
sva-finder.kathnrw: North rhine-westphalian dioceses (diocese of Aachen, diocese of Essen, archdiocese of Köln, diocese of Münster (north-rhine-westphalian part), archdiocese of Paderborn)
sva-finder.kathmsw: Middle and southwestern German dioceses (archdiocese of Freiburg, diocese of Fulda, diocese of Limburg, diocese of Mainz, diocese of Rottenburg-Stuttgart, diocese of Speyer, diocese of Trier)
sva-finder.kathnd: Northern German dioceses (archdiocese of Hamburg, diocese of Hildesheim, diocese of Osnabrück, diocese of Münster (lower saxonian part))
sva-finder.kathod: Eastern German dioceses (archdiocese of Berlin, diocese of Dresden-Meißen, diocese of Erfurt, diocese of Görlitz, diocese of Magdeburg, Catholic military chaplaincy)
sva-finder.rundfunk-q: Which public service broadcaster does your request concern?
sva-finder.rundfunk-beitragsservice-q: In which state do you pay broadcasting license fees?

donation-widget.how-much: How much do you want to donate?
donation-widget.how: How do you want to pay?
donation-widget.amount-no-fees: We’ll get the full amount of {{amount}} €.
donation-widget.error-donation-server: Server error when trying to fetch donation status.
donation-widget.error-auth-url-malformed-response: Invalid response from our payment provider. Please try again later.
donation-widget.error-amount-too-little: Unfortunately, we can only accept donations less than 1 € by bank transfer due to the high transaction fees. Please choose a higher amount or select “bank transfer” as the payment method.
donation-widget.no-mollie-id: The payment could not be found on the server. This is normal if you didn't pay via Mollie.
donation-widget.bank-transfer-info: In the next step, we are going to show you our bank details so that you can transfer your donation.
donation-widget.paysafecard-info: In the next step, we will redirect you to our partner Mollie.
donation-widget.creditcard-info: In the next step, we will redirect you to our partner Mollie.
donation-widget.paypal-info: In the next step. we will redirect you to PayPal.
donation-widget.cryptocurrency-info: In the next step, we will redirect you to our partner CoinGate.
donation-widget.directdebit-info: In the next step, we will redirect you to our partner Mollie. If you want to pay recurringly, you can also consider becoming a member.
donation-widget.mollie-info: Our partner Mollie also offers several other payment methods, including Sofortüberweisung, giropay, iDEAL, EPS, CDC and Bancontact.

hints.new-generator:
We have developed a new interface for the generator that is more intuitive to use and makes it easier to send many requests. Why not give it a try?
But don’t worry: If you prefer the old interface, you can still use it. We don’t plan on discontinuing it.
hints.advanced-generator:
Welcome to the new interface for our generator. We hope that it is more intuitive to use and makes it easier to send many requests.
But don’t worry: If you prefer the old interface, you can still use it. We don’t plan on discontinuing it.

report-misconduct.encryption-explanation: When you send your message, it will be automatically encrypted in your browser and can thus only be read by the person(s) appointed for anti-harassment. If you want to receive an encrypted reply, you need to provide corresponding contact details.
report-misconduct.send-success: Your report has been sent successfully.
report-misconduct.send-error: Your report could not be sent for technical reasons. Please try again later or try the alternative contact methods.
